name: treatment of waste plastic, mixture, sanitary landfill | waste plastic, mixture | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11079/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'waste plastic, mixture' in a sanitary landfill. Recommended use of this dataset: For plastic mixture, which goes to disposal as part of communal waste mixture. Inventoried waste consists of fraction: 100% Mixed various plastics; . Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): gross heating value 34.05 MJ/kg; net heating value 30.79 MJ/kg; H2O 153000; O 73717; H 105910; C 633590; S 1406.7; N 6112; P na; B na; Cl 18131; Br 65.319; F 13.717; I na; Ag na; As 1.7729; Ba 174.03; Cd 75.786; Co 29.478; Cr 38.132; Cu 296.41; Hg 0.79234; Mn 74.574; Mo na; Ni 19.222; Pb 435.81; Sb 40.093; Se 1.9596; Sn 24.453; V 268.88; Zn 521.69; Be 0.46656; Sc na; Sr 82.582; Ti 933.13; Tl 0.37325; W na; Si na; Fe 3476.5; Ca na; Al 186.63; K na; Mg na; Na 1367.5. Share of carbon in initial waste waste that is biogenic 0%. Share of metals in waste not oxidised and bulk-recyclable (exclude very small or thin parts) Iron: 0%; Alu: 0%; Copper: 0%. Overall degradability of waste during 100 years: 1%. Landfill gas capture and utilisation generates 0.004806 kWh of electricity and 0.008668 MJ of useful heat. 0.0002929 kg waste mass remains in the landfill even after the long term period. 

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfill are released to the environment (air due to landfil gas, water due to landfil leachate, and subsequent into groundwater).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The site has mean annual temperature (MAT) of 16.743579766537 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 1250.84108527132 mm/year, and net infiltration of 790.252035689178 mm/year.The leachate percolating through the landfill has an average residence time of 6.33 years.;References;UN data, 2020. Precipitation, Environment Statistics Database, United Nations Statistics Division Available at: http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?q=precipitation&d=ENV&f=variableID%3a6;;World Bank, 2022. Surface area (sq.km), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.SRF.TOTL.K2;;Doka G.,2021. A model for composition-specific life cycle inventories of regionalised wastewater fates, Zurich, Switzerland. http://www.doka.ch/publications.htm
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This is an inventory for a sanitary (controlled) landfill for municipal solid waste. Ultimate average landfill height is 20 meters. Operation phase duration is 30 years. The total raw landfill gas mass produced in the landfill from this waste is 0.007913 kg. The total CH4 mass in the raw landfill gas is 0.006151 kg. Percentage of landfill gas directly emitted is 47w%. Percentage of landfill gas captured and flared is 18.02w%. Percentage of landfill gas captured and utilised is 34.98%. Conversion efficiencies are 27.8e% for electricity and 13.5e% for useful heat. Leachate collected during the first 100 years is collected and treated region-specifically before emission. Based on average waste composition and climate data the end of carbonate phase is estimated to be reached 2'863 years after waste deposition.
